item.title: [HBASE-13787] use a cli argument parsing library instead of ad-hoc string handling
item.description:
several of our mapreduce based tools manually parse strings or rely on system properties for hteir configuration. update all to use the same cli argument parsing library.

The particular library used isn't important, but it should be one we already bring in for some other reason.

If possible try to make the arguments consistent across all the tools, since you'll be looking broadly.
item.summary: use a cli argument parsing library instead of ad-hoc string handling

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Sounds like a similar intention to HBASE-8074.

In CopyTable we are expecting user the pass arguments "[--starttime=X] [--endtime=Y]" in this fashion and in ImportTsv as -D arguments. So what I think we can expect user to pass the arguments in the same fashion as CopyTable for all the tools and then internally parse this arguments using Apache's CommandLineParser.
This is what you are expecting here ?
that sounds reasonable. The one caveat would be to make sure commons-cli's CommandLineParser is what we're already using for argument parsing in other places.

In examples:

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.example.BufferedMutatorExample uses org.apache.hadoop.util.ToolRunner which uses org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser which uses org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.IndexBuilder uses org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser which uses org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine, and reads two other parameters directly from args

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.SampleUploader uses org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser which uses org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine, and reads two other parameters directly from args

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.thrift.DemoClient parses arguments directly

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.thrift.HttpDoAsClient parses arguments directly

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.thrift2.DemoClient parses arguments directly

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.replication.VerifyReplication parses arguments with callback from ToolRunner
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.CellCounter uses org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser which uses org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine, and reads two other parameters directly from args
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.CopyTable parses arguments with callback from ToolRunner
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.Driver defers to ProgramDriver to parse
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.Export uses org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser which uses org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine, and reads two other parameters directly from args
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.Import uses org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser which uses org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine, and reads two other parameters directly from args
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.ImportTsv uses org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser which uses org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine, and reads two other parameters directly from args
org.apache.commons.cli.LoadIncrementalHFiles uses org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser which uses org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine, and reads two other parameters directly from args
org.apache.commons.cli.RowCounter uses org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser which uses org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine, and reads two other parameters directly from args
org.apache.commons.cli.WALPlayer uses org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser which uses org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine, and reads two other parameters directly from args
commons-cli sounds like it'll work just fine then.
